clusters.name: JavaScript Core Concepts
clusters.description: This cluster covers fundamental concepts in JavaScript, essential for understanding how the language works internally and how scope and execution are managed, forming the bedrock for more advanced topics.

items.reason: This item, conceptually 'JavaScript Execution Context and Hoisting', introduces foundational concepts of JavaScript's execution model. Understanding how code is compiled and executed, and how variables/functions are hoisted, is a prerequisite for grasping more complex scoping mechanisms.

Building directly upon the understanding of execution contexts and lexical environments, this item, conceptually 'Understanding Closures in JavaScript', explains how closures work. It's a natural progression as closures are a powerful JavaScript feature enabled by these foundational concepts.
